Class GUI

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  javax.swing.JApplet
                      GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JApplet
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener

This class implements a graphical user interface to a Diffusion Monte Carlo simulation, complete with parameter input and graphical visualization of certain outputs.

Be warned: I've tried to keep the code as clean as possible, but I am still learning Swing, and this design is far from perfect. I feel that it has become a bit bloated, and could use some modularization. In fact, with all the private variables, it's a bit like programming in C again with globals. O:-)

Suggestions for future improvement:

  • Modularize all aspects of each type of graph into another class, and get the graph specific members out of this high up GUI.
  • Modularize all aspects of each potential into another class, etc.
  • Remove all unnecessary data members, perhaps through using action commands in the event handling instead of the event source.
  • Modularize the event handling into multiple classes that each handle events from a certain type of object. As it is, the event handling is fairly bloated.

    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Ian Terrell (itterr@wm.edu)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    delay

    private int delay
    The millisecond delay between executing sets of nIterations simulation iterations.

    nIterations

    private int nIterations
    The number of simulation iterations to run at a time.

    private int e0Iterations
    The number of simulation iterations to record e0 estimate.

    private int warmup
    The number of simulation iterations to warm up with.

    refEnergy

    private double refEnergy
    The reference energy used in the simulation.

    refEnergyConstant

    private boolean refEnergyConstant
    Whether or not the reference energy should be held constant in the simulation.

    private int numWalkers
    The number of walkers to start the simulation with.

    The timestep used in the simulation.

    private double alpha
    The feedback parameter alpha used in the simulation.

    The random variate generator seed used in the simulation.

    The x_0 parameter of the Delta Function used for walker initialization.

    The mu parameter of the Gaussian(mu,sigma) distribution used for walker initialization.

    The sigma parameter of the Gaussian(mu,sigma) distribution used for walker initialization.

    getPreferredSize

    public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()

    init

    public void init()
    Necessary to be an applet - does nothing.

    start

    public void start()
    This method acts as the main function for the application. The GUI is set up and everything is initialized. When run as an applet the JVM starts execution here, when run as an application the main function will call it.

    resetSimulation

    private void resetSimulation()
    This function resets the simulation to its empty state. It sets the simulation to a blank simulation, empties the current graphs and their data, resets the graphs to blank data, and disables all the main buttons save "start." Should be called at the beginning of the GUI setup and when the "reset" button is pressed.

    setupBlankSimulation

    private void setupBlankSimulation()
    This function sets up a blank simulation of the type selected by the potential combo box.

    assignDefaultValues

    private void assignDefaultValues()
    This function uses the event handling mechanisms, among others, to assign the default values to the GUI's input boxes, etc. Should be called at the beginning of a simulation and when the "Use Defaults" button is pressed.

    resetTextField

    private void resetTextField(javax.swing.JTextField tf)
    Resets a text field to its default value.

    resetTimer

    private void resetTimer()
    This function resets the timer with the delay given by the GUI editable variable. Should be called at the beginning of a simulation, and whenever the value of delay changes.

    componentsSetEditable

    private void componentsSetEditable(boolean b)
    This method sets certain components to be editable or enabled, depending on the parameter. This should be called by the start button to disable the components at the beginning of a simulation, and by the reset button to enable them after the end of a simulation.

    Parameters:
    b - The boolean flag to set the components' states to.

    public void stop()
    Necessary to be an applet - does nothing.

    Necessary to be an applet - does nothing.

    actionPerformed

    public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
    This method handles the action events thrown by various GUI members, including the simulation timer, all of the buttons (button buttons, check boxes, and radio buttons), and the combo boxes.

    It is important that the simulationTimer is the first one in the list of checked for events, as it needs to run quickly to finish before the next simulation event is thrown.

    This should be modularized into multiple classes in the future. Although I use good naming practices and the individual parts of this function are readable, it is getting bulky.

    Specified by:
    actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Parameters:
    e - The ActionEvent to handle.

    stateChanged

    public void stateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent e)
    This function handles the change events. Well, there's only one so far, so this function handles the numBins slider.

    Specified by:
    stateChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
    Parameters:
    e - The ChangeEvent to handle.

    focusGained

    public void focusGained(java.awt.event.FocusEvent e)
    This function doesn't do anything, as I don't care when a user clicks on something (that doesn't generate an action event, that is.

    Specified by:
    focusGained in interface java.awt.event.FocusListener
    Parameters:
    e - The FocusEvent to ignore.

    focusLost

    public void focusLost(java.awt.event.FocusEvent e)
    This method handles the focus events generated by the focus leaving a particular element. This is used to update the values of variables when the focus leaves their text box. If the value is not valid, this method returns it to its default.

    Specified by:
    focusLost in interface java.awt.event.FocusListener
    Parameters:
    e - The FocusEvent to handle.

    updateHistograms

    private void updateHistograms()
    This method updates all of the visible histograms, including changing the number of bins, xMin, xMax, the color, whether or not to normalize, the mode, as well as whether or not to graph SHO's Phi_0 function.

    updatePhi0EstimateGraphs

    private void updatePhi0EstimateGraphs()
    This method updates all of the visible phi0Estimate graphs.

    private void updateE0EstimateGraphs()
    This method updates the mode, color, and max points of the visible E0 estimate graphs.

    updateRefEnergyGraphs

    private void updateRefEnergyGraphs()
    This method updates the mode, color, max points, as well as whether or not to graph SHO's E_0 function on all of the visible reference energy graphs.

                          int width,
                          int height)

    changeCardPanel

    private void changeCardPanel(javax.swing.JPanel p,
                             javax.swing.JComboBox cb)
    This function changes the visible panel in a CardLayout'd panel to what was selected by a combo box.

    Parameters:
    p - The JPanel with the CardLayout in which we want to change the visible panel.
    cb - The JComboBox which contains the string of the panel we want to change to.
